TestCase.TestCaseTitle: Implicit Value-Ranges - Invalid Domain Value Numbers
TestCase.TestCaseObjective: Check if the systems verify the number ranges according the schema and are able to handle invalid schema information. Further will be checked, if the systems are able to handle valid schema ranges which are outside intended MIM ranges (i.e. totalDigits=6, fractionDigits=2 allows in the schema the maximum value of 999999 but according MIM interpretation of the schema definition only 9999.99)
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: Send objects for which a range is defined. Use numbers which are outside the schema definition. Further use numbers which are inside the schema definition and outside the intended MIM range.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: The nations Gateway and the TT are ready to connect and have a physical connection with each other. Also the SOAP connection is established and ready for transport.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: This test is considered a success the Gateway remains stable and handles all messages correctly.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: The nation loads MIP4SLT2.5_2405_a into their C2 system (2) through the TT (1). This file includes a chemical attack with values outside the schema definition.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: The consumer reports an error to the producer/provider.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: The nation loads MIP4SLT2.5_2405_b into their C2 system (2) through the TT (1). This file includes a armoured personell carrier with values inside the schema range but outside the intended MIM range.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: The consumer system has to handle the information and could inform the producer/provider that the quality of the data might be compromised.
